TextView.android:text: Every question is solvable. All you need to do is crack the clues, give the answer and write your name into the pages of quizzing history! Over the years, QUESTION MARK has become a quiz par excellence. For a college quizzer, it represents the pinnacle of achievement. So come one and all, once again to QUESTION MARK- the numero uno event of Techtrix 2016! The ultimate quizzing experience awaits you. Calling the brightest and sharpest of minds from all over the city and beyond- It’s time to unleash your quizzing acumen and go for glory!

* The quiz is open to students of any recognized institution- college or school. 
* Teams are allowed from a minimum of 2 to a maximum of 3 members. 
* Team-mates maybe from separate institutions (college or school). 
* ID cards are compulsory. 
* It is a 2 round event. 
* No books, internet, etc are allowed for reference. 
* Anyone adopting any sort of unfair means will be immediately disqualified.

* It will be an MCQ based offline test. 
* There will be 30 questions and the time limit would be 30 minutes. 
* +2 marks would be awarded for each correct answer and -1 for each wrong answer. 
* No scribbling/ scratching is allowed. Once an answer is marked, it’s final. 
* The questions will be based on general knowledge of a wide variety of subjects like politics, science, technology, business, history, etc. 
* Top 8 teams would qualify for the 2nd round

* It will be a verbal round sub-divided into 4 rounds- Random, Connect the pictures, Guess who and Pick your choice. 
* In “Random”, 2 questions on random topics would be asked to each team. 10 points for correct answer and no negative marks for wrong answer. In case of a wrong answer, the question will be passed to the next team with +5 as bonus points. 
* In “Connect the pictures”, 3 picture based questions would be asked to each team. Each of these pictures will be a collage of 4 pictures. The team has to connect those 4 pictures and answer what they depict. 
* +20 will be awarded for each correct answer and -10 for each wrong answer. The team can choose to pass the question but it will carry no bonus points. 
* The time limit for each question would be 1:30 minutes. 
* The team can ask for a maximum of 2 clues with each clue costing 5 points. 
* “Guess who” would be open to all the teams and 8 questions will be asked. The teams will have to guess who the question is about. 
* 3 clues will be provided: 
 Answer using only the first clue, if right +30, if wrong -15. 
 Answer using 2 clues, if right +20, if wrong -10. 
 Answer using 3 clues, if right +10, if wrong -5. 
* Whichever team raises their hand first, will get the chance to answer. 
* “Pick your choice”would be a rapid-fire round in which each team would be asked to pick a subject and 10 questions on that subject would be asked to them. 
* +10 will be awarded for each correct answer and no negative marks for wrong answer. 
* The top 2 teams would be awarded with the prize. 
* In case of a tie, a tie-breaker audio round would be held in which each team will be required to identify 5 audio files each and the team with the maximum score would be adjudged the winner
Note : Rules are Subject to Change if Circumstances Demands
REGISTRATION FEE: 100 (per team of 3 or less)
Starts at 26th February (Sunday)\n * On-Spot Registration\n * Show your interest in this event by registering here -> bit.ly/2l8Xnhn.
